verses.roman:
kācit karāmbujaṁ śaurer
jagṛhe 'ñjalinā mudā
kācid dadhāra tad-bāhum
aṁse candana-bhūṣitam

synonyms: kācit—one of them; kara-ambujam—the lotus hand; śaureḥ—of Lord Kṛṣṇa; jagṛhe—seized; añjalinā—in her folded palms; mudā—with joy; kācit—another; dadhāra—put; tat-bāhum—His arm; aṁse—on her shoulder; candana—with sandalwood paste; bhūṣitam—adorned.
translation: One gopī joyfully took Kṛṣṇa's hand between her folded palms, and another placed His arm, anointed with sandalwood paste, on her shoulder.
